title: Goldman Sachs Took an Earnings Hit From Its Uber and WeWork Investments
text:
Goldman Sachs Group (ticker GS) was stung by equity investments in Uber Technologies (UBER), WeWork parent We, and other companies during the third quarter, underscoring the risk of the firm’s opaque business of making principal investments.

The equity losses were a key contributor as Goldman’s weaker-than-expected results, as earnings fell 24% to $4.79 a share in the third quarter from $6.28 in the year-earlier period. The third-quarter earnings were below the consensus estimate of $4.98 per share.
